Resilient Systems REST API: ConstDTO

  3. ConstDTO

ConstDTO Data Type

This type contains constant information for the server. This information is useful in translating names that the user sees to IDs that other REST API endpoints accept. For example, the IncidentDTO has a property called "crimestatus_id". The valid values are stored in ConstDTO's "crime_statuses" property.

This information generally only changes for new releases of Resilient.

Properties
name data type description
nist_attack_vectors object A map of the possible NIST attack vector values. The key portion of the map contains the IDs and the value portion contains a NISTAttackVectorDTO.

These values come from NIST 800-61 (see http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/800-61rev2/SP800-61rev2.pdf).

See also: incidentDTO (nist_attack_vectors property)
period_types array of string An array of the possible period type values. These values are used when retrieving data from the OrgStatisticsREST resource (see the incidents_by_type_over_time and new_and_open_incidents endpoints).
predefined_items array of PredefinedViewItemDTO An array of the default wizard items and incident tabs represented by PredefinedViewItemDTO elements.
task_statuses object A map of possible task statuses. The key portion of the map is the task status code. The value portion is a taskStatusDTO.

See also: taskDTO (status property)
states object A map of possible US state values. The key portion of the map is the ID of the state The value portion of the map is a stateDTO.

Note that the ID for a given state is the same as it's geo ID. See the "geos" property.
incident_statuses object A map of possible incident statuses. The key portion of the map contains the status code and the value portion is a incidentStatusDTO.

See also: partialIncidentDTO (plan_status property)
harm_statuses object A map of possible harm status values. The key portion of the map contains the ID of the harm status. The value portion contains a harmStatusDTO

See also: incidentPIIDTO (harmstatus_id property)
crime_statuses object A map of possible crime status values. The key portion of the map contains the ID of the crime status. The value portion contains a crimeStatusDTO.

See also: incidentDTO (crimestatus_id property)
regulators object A map of possible regulator values. The key portion of the map contains the ID of the regulator. The value portion contains a regulatorDTO.

See also: regulatorsDTO.
industries object A map of possible industry values. The key portion of the map contains the ID of the industry. The value portion contains an industryDTO.
industry_regulators_map object A map of industries to regulators. These are regulators that apply for the specified industry. The key of this map is the industry ID and the value is the regulator ID. See also "regulators" and "industries" properties.
timeframes object A map of possible timeframe values. The key portion of the map contains the IDs and the value portion contains a timeframeDTO.
data_types object A map of possible data type values. The key portion of the map contains the data type ID and the value portion contains a dataTypeDTO.

See also: fullIncidentDataDTO (dtm property)
geos object A map of possible "geo" values. A geo is short for geographical region. It can be a region (such as Europe), country (such as United States) or a state/province (such as Massachusetts or Manitoba). The ID portion of the map is the geo ID. The value portion is a geoDTO.

Geo IDs are specified in the incidentCountsDTO to indicate how many records have been lost for a particular state/province.

Geo IDs are also used to specify the state and country properties of the incidentDTO.
data_formats object

A map of possible data formats. The following are examples of data formats:

  • Paper
  • Electronic
  • Verbal

The key portion of the map is the data format ID. The value contains a dataFormatTypeDTO.

See also: incidentPIIDTO (data_format property).
artifact_types array of IncidentArtifactTypeDTO A list of possible built-in artifact types. See incidentArtifactTypeDTO.
NOTE: Starting with version 28 this returns only the standard built-in system artifact types. This will be deprecated in version 29.
Using this data structure the incidentArtifactTypeDTO has only the following fields filled in:
id
name
desc
reg_exp
multi_aware
file
Instead of this use ORGRest GET to get the entire list of artifact types from fullOrgDTO.incident_artifact_types to get the full list of artifacts, both system and custom.
For create, update, delete operations on artifact types use OrgIncidentArtifactTypeREST resource.
actions_framework ActionsFrameworkInfoDTO Information about the actions framework.
max_attachment_mb number The maximum allowed attachment size (in megabytes).
max_artifacts number The maximum number of allowed artifacts to be loaded at same time.
input_types object A mapping of input type name to InputTypeDTO. This map allows you to get information about input types in the system (e.g. what "methods" they support for conditions and the valid types to which a type can be transformed).
action_types object The supported action type IDs and their names. The key portion of the map is the ID. The value portion is the display value.
action_object_types object The supported action object type IDs and their names. The key portion of the map is the ID. The value portion is the display value.
message_destination_types object
pivot PivotConstDTO Get the constant data for pivoting services.

See PivotConstDTO.
time_units array of TimeUnitDTO A list of the supported time units for automatic tasks and system task overrides.
server_version ServerVersionDTO The server version.
script_languages object The supported scripting languages.

Example

{
  "nist_attack_vectors" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "period_types" : [ "...", "..." ],
  "predefined_items" : [ {
    "name" : "...",
    "predefined_uuid" : "...",
    "layout_type" : 12345
  }, {
    "name" : "...",
    "predefined_uuid" : "...",
    "layout_type" : 12345
  } ],
  "task_statuses" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "states" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "incident_statuses" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "harm_statuses" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "crime_statuses" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "regulators" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "industries" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "industry_regulators_map" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "timeframes" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "data_types" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "geos" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "data_formats" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "actions_framework" : {
    "enabled" : true,
    "destination_types" : {
      "property1" : "...",
      "property2" : "..."
    },
    "action_types" : {
      "property1" : "...",
      "property2" : "..."
    },
    "action_object_types" : {
      "property1" : "...",
      "property2" : "..."
    },
    "action_invocation_statuses" : {
      "property1" : "...",
      "property2" : "..."
    },
    "action_invocation_message_types" : {
      "property1" : "...",
      "property2" : "..."
    }
  },
  "max_attachment_mb" : 12345,
  "max_artifacts" : 12345,
  "input_types" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "action_types" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "action_object_types" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "message_destination_types" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  },
  "pivot" : {
    "bucket_bys" : {
      "property1" : "...",
      "property2" : "..."
    },
    "field_types" : {
      "property1" : "...",
      "property2" : "..."
    },
    "function_types" : {
      "property1" : "...",
      "property2" : "..."
    }
  },
  "time_units" : [ {
    "name" : "...",
    "value" : "..."
  }, {
    "name" : "...",
    "value" : "..."
  } ],
  "server_version" : {
    "major" : 12345,
    "minor" : 12345,
    "build_number" : 12345,
    "version" : "..."
  },
  "script_languages" : {
    "property1" : "...",
    "property2" : "..."
  }
}
